page.title: 10ENTERTAINMENT IN NEWTOWN
page.content: The most popular form of entertainment is definetely the television; in a small survey approximately.70% admitted watching television often. Outside of the home the most popular "entertainment" was connected with one or more of the thirty organisations existing in Soberton and Newtown. Teenagers are less well catered for and apart from the public houses most go out of the village for their entertainment. Portsmouth, Southampton and Chichester offer live concerts, films and ballet. Rookesbury Hall is used mainly by the Newtown Horticultural Society, Holy Trinity Fellowship, Women's Institute and the Dog Training School. Yoga lessons are held periodically and it is used for meetings by other groups and for private parties. Town Cycling Clubs use it during races at weekends.
